alert.note: Alert for Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 11:48AM MDT until June 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Forsyth affecting Rosebud and Treasure Counties. .Minor flooding impacts have been reported in Treasure and Rosebud Counties. There are indications water levels have dropped in portions of Treasure County, but flood waters continue to move down the Yellowstone River with a crest expected in the Forsyth area of Rosebud County this evening. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding occurring in areas without protective structures, and could be serious locally. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Forsyth. * WHEN...through Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Friday, June 17 the stage was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet this evening, Friday, June 17. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet at Forsyth, but areas unprotected by flood prevention structures will flood at lower levels. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 05/30/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please use extreme caution or wait until waters have receded if attempting to reach stranded livestock. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
